title: Security Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lovelace Health System (Albuquerque, NM) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: Took too long and a long process they had me wait too long and was confused which one I was supposed to go to the west side? The women’s hospital i didn’t know.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a upset patient

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Lovelace Health System (Albuquerque, NM)
Interview Descriptions:
Questions included:
Tell me about yourself
Tell me about a time where you had to help your team
Where do you see yourself in 5 years

A lot of small talk and walking around the units
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had a difficult patient or family member.

title: INSURANCE VERIFIER Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lovelace Health System
Interview Descriptions: Easy and quick. Staff was friendly. Interviewed and had an offer made the next day.  Interview questions are standard. Easy questions. Interviewed lasted about 30 minutes . Recruiter was also friendly.

title: Physical Therapy Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Lovelace Health System (Albuquerque, NM) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quick, informative, and educational. The interviewer’s wanted to know why I was interested in this role, and why I was interested in physical therapy. But overall they were really friendly.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in Physical Therapy?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Lovelace Health System (Albuquerque, NM) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by a panel from different departments. They took turns asking questions. It was a good experience even though I did not end up accepting the position. I ended up taking a position closer to home.
Interview Questions: How did you handle a mistake in the past

title: Clinical Dietitian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lovelace Health System
Interview Descriptions: Interview was the normal process with members of the team.  Cook was present.  Rather easygoing people and seemed nice.  The job seemed very intense but I would welcome the challenge.
Interview Questions: Describe a crisis you experienced on the job.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lovelace Health System (Albuquerque, NM) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Quickly received a call after applying, interviewed the following day. The interviewer was punctual and friendly, but a little scattered throughout the interview. Overall it was a comfortable, but long interview.
Interview Questions: What is a mistake that you have made, and what did you do about it?

title: Registered Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Lovelace Health System (Albuquerque, NM) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: First you had a phone interview with Human Resources. If The interview was a three person panel interview. The panel was made up of the director of the respiratory department and two senior staff members
Interview Questions: Define a time you had an issue with a colleague and how did you handle it?

title: PRN Customer Service Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lovelace Health System
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted by the manager and had an interview the next day. The manager explained the job and what it entails and how it could lead to a full time position very fast.
Interview Questions: Give an example of when you had to deal with an angry customer?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Lovelace Health System (Albuquerque, NM) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted by Manager. Then sent to HR. Very quick and simple. About one month passed between application and being contacted. They guided me through the signing of paperwork. I did have to take a drug test and pass a background check. They replied promptly to phone calls and emails.
Interview Questions: What my experience as a nurse was.

title: Informatics Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Lovelace Health System (Albuquerque, NM) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied on line. Called for interview 2-3 weeks later. Interview, and then online status gets updated by company. It took about 3 more weeks to get declined. No email or call, just an update on their employee application site.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to sort out a problem and what you did to handle it.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Lovelace Health System (Albuquerque, NM)
Interview Descriptions: Multiple interviews with groups of leaders, employees, and other managers. They use a personality test before extending an invitation to interview. Once you begin the interview process, it seems like a long time between contacts, so you aren't really sure what is taking so long. They bring you in for a full day of interviews, with multiple groups. How well the senior leadership likes you determines if you will move on in the process, and you may not hear how you did for a while, if at all.

title: Clinical Document Improvement Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Lovelace Health System (Albuquerque, NM) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Process was lame.  Person interviewing me, the head of HIM who is a woman, did not have any clinical experience and clearly has spent the past 20 years supervising only people who have to scan medical records and/or photocopy for ROI.  The role of CDIS is very clinical and this interviewer seemed uncomfortable with my experience as an ICU/CCU nurse with additional ER RN skills and flight nurse skills.

title: Clinical Document Improvement Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Lovelace Health System (Albuquerque, NM) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied for position in December.  I was not contacted until February 2013.  I got the impression that the corporate office runs on its' own time schedule, flying in and out of Albuquerque on a whim.  Most of the people contacted appeared to have been just off a vacation, just had their facial and hair done and enough time to shop in Dallas for an expensive outfit.  Definitely the 1% group.
Interview Questions: None.  They were  very ill prepared in this category.

title: Chief Executive Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lovelace Health System in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: On phone, in person, remote with corporate.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lovelace Health System (Albuquerque, NM) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was an entire day with representatives from many departments.  Began in the morning with future supervisor, then business customers, then with the team that would report to me.  Overall a very good experience.
Interview Questions: They asked for a recent situation where I needed to make a decision to solve a large problem that involved multiple departments or teams.

title: Pharmacy Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lovelace Health System (Albuquerque, NM) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: The interview was great. I knew the people interviewing me so it wasnt so intimidating.
Interview Questions: What could you bring to this hospital?
